section.title: Device Groups
section.para: The device-groups configuration object provides the mechanism to make the whole of a physical disk available to a service.
section.screen: device-groups: - name: vsa-data consumer: name: vsa usage: data devices: - name: /dev/sdc - name: vsa-cache consumer: name: vsa usage: adaptive-optimization devices: - name: /dev/sdb

row.entry: An administrator-defined name for the device group.

entry.para: A list of named devices to be assigned to this group. There must be at least one device in the group.
Multipath storage should be listed as the corresponding /dev/mapper/mpath<x>

row.entry: Identifies the name of one of the storage services (e.g. one of the following: Swift, Cinder, Ceph, VSA, etc) that will consume the disks in this device group.
These will vary according to the service consuming the device group. The examples section provides sample content for the different services.
